The acting game is a hazardous road, too many mis-steps and you can fall off the relevance radar really quickly.  Ben is reminding Matt that it’s ok to do the “art picture” that he actually want’s to do, but that it’s important to buffer them with the “safe picture” that’s a guaranteed money maker or Emmy bait to stay relevant and in high demand.

And then to suffix some real advice, Kevin Smith throws some of that classic self deprecating shade his own way, by getting Ben to break the 4th and 5th walls by possibly referring to how being in Kevin’s most popular films has been helping Ben Affleck’s career up to that point

Actual quote:

You’re like a child. What’ve I been telling you? You gotta do the safe picture. Then you can do the art picture. But then sometimes you gotta do the payback picture because your friend says you owe him.
